item.title: Shopify Rebellion Becomes First VALORANT Game Changers Team to Qualify for Challengers
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/shopify-rebellion-becomes-first-game-changers-team-to-reach-challengers/

The Shopify Rebellion Game Changers roster, the reigning two-time champions, have made history. The women became the first GC team to qualify for a VALORANT Challengers event, after years of attempts.

The roster core that has dominated the women’s VALORANT scene has finally overcome their greatest obstacle on the path to their ultimate goal: the international VCT leagues.

Shopify Rebellion Makes History

While the Shopify Rebellion Game Changers team has dominated the GC circuit, they had always fallen short of advancing past qualifiers into Challengers. For VALORANT teams, the Challengers leagues are the path to the Ascension event, a regional tournament that determines who is promoted to the international VCT leagues.

After winning their second Game Changers Championship in December, Shopify were dealt a huge blow when their star Ava “florescent” Eugene signed with VCT EMEA team Apeks. In doing so, flor became the first Game Changers player to compete in VCT, but it left a big hole in the roster for Shopify to fill. 

Just prior to the North American Challengers closed qualifier, Shopify found their replacement in Karnthida “dodonut” Chaisrakeo. In the closed qualifier, Shopify overcame dodonut’s former team, FlyQuest RED, before beating Funhaver to secure the third and final qualifier spot in NA Challengers.

For the Shopify Rebellion organization, fresh off their merger with content creator stars Cr1TiKaL and Ludwig’s Moist Esports, they will field two roster in NA Challengers, as their men’s roster returns after competing in the league last year. Organizations are permitted by Riot to field two teams in the same ecosystem, provided one of them is eligible to compete in Game Changers. The Shopify GC roster is the two-time champion of Game Changers, so they should be permitted to compete when the NA Challengers League stage one begins later this month.

Can the Shopify Rebellion Game Changers players reach VCT? Tell us what you think below and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the exclusive report on what’s coming to Xbox Game Pass in February.

item.title: EA Says Dragon Age: The Veilguard Didn’t Meet Revenue Expectations
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ea-says-dragon-age-the-veilguard-didnt-meet-revenue-expectations/

EA has announced that Dragon Age: The Veilguard failed to meet the company’s internal expectations. In its preliminary Q3 FY2025 earnings report, EA revealed that it was forced to lower its revenue forecast for both the quarter and fiscal year after the first Dragon Age game in 10 years missed expectations by a wide margin.

“Dragon Age engaged approximately 1.5 million players during the quarter, down nearly 50% from the company’s expectations,” the company said.

Because of the lower player engagement of Dragon Age: The Veilguard—as well as EA Sports FC 25—EA adjusted its expected net bookings for the year to be between $7-$7.15 billion compared to the originally expected $7.5-$7.8 billion. For the quarter itself, EA has adjusted its expectations to $2.21 billion in net bookings.

“During Q3, we continued to deliver high-quality games and experiences across our portfolio; however, Dragon Age and EA SPORTS FC 25 underperformed our net bookings expectations,” said EA CEO Andrew Wilson in a prepared statement. “We remain confident in our long-term strategy and expect a return to growth in FY26, as we execute against our pipeline.”

Dragon Age: The Veilguard was released on October 31, 2024 to generally favorable reviews from critics. The game’s director, Corine Busche, recently left BioWare after 18 years with the company for a new opportunity.

EA will present its full earnings on February 4 at 5pm ET/2pm PT. Insider Gaming will have full coverage of the call when it takes place.

What do you think of Dragon Age: The Veilguard missing internal expectations at EA? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our exclusive on two titles set to come to Xbox Game Pass in February and what NASCAR series is making its console game debut in iRacing’s NASCAR 25. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Season 2 Gets Five New Maps, Including One Classic Map
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-season-2-gets-five-new-maps-including-one-classic-map/

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is getting five new maps in Season 2. The first details for those maps were confirmed via the Season 2 launch trailer, but, now, Activision has released full details on the new multiplayer maps coming to the game.

The five new maps are Bounty, Lifeline, Dealership, Grind, and Bullet. Three maps—Bounty, Lifeline, and Dealership—will be available at launch on January 28 while the other two will come mid-season.

Details of each map can be found below via Activision.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 2 Multiplayer Maps

Bounty (at launch)

Bounty is a new 6v6 medium-sized map that takes place in a penthouse at the top of an Avalon skyscraper.

“From the starting point of a pristine Patio, move inside an opulent, gold-plated Nightclub and Lounge where top-shelf entertaining was provided to a variety of rich guests,” the map’s description reads. “Ambush enemies by jumping over the light fixtures hanging over the Lobby below.”

Lifeline (at launch)

It may seem similar to Black Ops 2’s Hijacked map, but Lifeline appears to be much smaller an more chaotic. A new small-sized map for Strike 2v2 and 6v6, Lifeline sees you fight on a high-end yacht that’s burning in the middle of the sea.

“From Bow to Aft, it won’t take long to collide in the center Bar and gambling den, the disco room, or along the steps on Portside and Starboard,” says Activision. “Keep your head on a swivel or risk getting thrown overboard.”

Dealership (at launch)

The last of the three Season 2 launch maps, Dealership is another medium-sized 6v6 map that takes place around the Pallasar car dealership. And while it looks like a dealership on the outside, it’s actually a front for a black market where cars are traded for weapons.

“Battle around the wreckage in the Car Lot and Showroom, pushing the fight into the interior Commissary and Lounge or out on the Courtyard and once offered an idyllic vista,” it’s description reads. “Open the sliding doors to either side of the Garage for a quick ambush or close them to stall incoming enemies.”

Grind (mid-season)

A remaster of the classic map from Call of Duty: Black Ops 2, Grind is a 6v6 medium-sized map that takes place in a skatepark. In addition to the outdoor skatepark, there is a pro shop and indoor stadium to fight your opponents in.

“Use the ramps for cover and to get above the competition and bust out your best tricks like the 360-corkscrew one-shot. Also expect an additional surprise related to this map, later in the season,” Activision said.

Bullet (mid-season)

Lastly, Bullet is another small map for Strike 2v2 and 6v6 multiplayer matches. The map takes players aboard a bullet train where you can go between train cars with little room to hide. If inside gets too tight, players can head to the roof of the train to fight.

“Race through the automatic sliding doors separating each car, from the first-class lounge through the dining car, second-class seats, and up to the cab where the fallen conductor dispels any hope of reaching the destination in one piece,” Activision writes.

What do you think of the new multiplayer maps coming in Black Ops 6 season 2? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our exclusive on two titles set to come to Xbox Game Pass in February. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
